intro: Prenanthes amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clustered bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Araceae family and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescence that resembles a small, rounded cluster. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with a spatulate spathe and a single stamen. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in wetland habitats, making it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
